dublinCore.dc:title: 114 S503 IS: Haitian Partnership Renewal Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Nelson introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Caribbean Basin Economic Recovery Act to extend trade preferences for certain articles imported from Haiti and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Haitian Partnership Renewal Act.

section.header: Extension of trade preferences for Haiti

paragraph.text: Section 213A(b) of the Caribbean Basin Economic Recovery Act (19 U.S.C. 2703a(b)) is amended—

clause.text: in subparagraph (B)(v)(I)(cc), by striking 2017. and inserting 2017, and in each succeeding 1-year period thereafter.; and

subclause.text: by striking December 19, 2018. and inserting December 19, 2030.; and

clause.text: in subparagraph (A)(ii), by striking 11 succeeding 1-year periods, and inserting succeeding 1-year periods through September 30, 2030,; and
in subparagraph (B)(iii), by striking 11 succeeding 1-year periods, and inserting succeeding 1-year periods through September 30, 2030,.

paragraph.text: Section 213A(h) of the Caribbean Basin Economic Recovery Act (19 U.S.C. 2703a(h)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking Except as provided in subsection (b)(1), the and inserting The; and
by striking September 30, 2020. and inserting September 30, 2030..

paragraph.header: Transition period treatment of certain textile and apparel articles
paragraph.text: Section 213(b)(2)(A)(iii) of the Caribbean Basin Economic Recovery Act (19 U.S.C. 2703(b)(2)(A)(iii)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subclause (II)(cc), by striking September 30, 2020. and inserting September 30, 2030.; and
in subclause (IV)(dd), by striking September 30, 2020. and inserting September 30, 2030..

paragraph.header: Transition period treatment of certain other apparel articles
paragraph.text: Section 213(b)(2)(A)(iv)(II) of the Caribbean Basin Economic Recovery Act (19 U.S.C. 2703(b)(2)(A)(iv)(II)) is amended by striking 18.
Section 213(b)(5)(D)(i) of the Caribbean Basin Economic Recovery Act (19 U.S.C. 2703(b)(5)(D)(i)) is amended by striking September 30, 2020; and inserting September 30, 2030;.

section.text: Section 213A(b)(3) of the Caribbean Basin Economic Recovery Act (19 U.S.C. 2703a(b)(3)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: Any article, other than an article described in clause (ii), that undergoes a change in Haiti to being classifiable under heading 6401, 6402, 6403, 6404, or 6405 of the HTS from being classifiable under any other heading of the HTS and is imported directly from Haiti or the Dominican Republic shall enter the United States free of duty, without regard to the source of the components from which the article is made.

section.text: Section 213A(c) of the Caribbean Basin Economic Recovery Act (19 U.S.C. 2703a(c)) is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: Any wire harness automotive component that is the product or manufacture of Haiti and is imported directly from Haiti into the customs territory of the United States shall enter the United States free of duty until September 30, 2030, if Haiti has met the requirements of subsection (d) and if the sum of—

clause.text: the cost or value of the materials produced in Haiti or one or more countries described in subsection (b)(2)(C), or any combination thereof, plus
the direct costs of processing operations (as defined in section 213(a)(3)) performed in Haiti or the United States, or both,

subparagraph.continuation-text: is not less than 35 percent of the declared customs value of such wire harness automotive component.

subparagraph.text: For purposes of this subsection, the term wire harness automotive component means any article provided for in subheading 8544.30.00 of the HTS, as in effect on December 20, 2006.

paragraph.text: Any article classifiable under subheading 4202.11, 4202.19, 4202.21, 4202.29, 4202.31, 4202.39, 4202.91, or 4202.99 of the HTS that undergoes a change in Haiti to being classifiable under that subheading from being classifiable under a chapter of the HTS other than chapter 42 and is imported directly from Haiti or the Dominican Republic shall enter the United States free of duty, without regard to the source of the components from which the article is made.

Any article classifiable under subheading 4203.10.40, 4203.29.08, or 4203.29.18 of the HTS that undergoes a change in Haiti to being classifiable under that subheading from being classifiable under a chapter of the HTS other than chapter 42 and is imported directly from Haiti or the Dominican Republic shall enter the United States free of duty, without regard to the source of the components from which the article is made.

paragraph.header: Lamps, lighting, and other electrical components
paragraph.text: Any article classifiable under subheading 8536.30, 8539.10, 8539.49, 9032.10, 9405.10, 9405.20, 9405.30, 9405.40, 9405.50, 9405.60, 9405.91, 9405.92, or 9405.99 of the HTS that undergoes a change in Haiti to being classifiable under that subheading from being classifiable under any other chapter of the HTS and is imported directly from Haiti or the Dominican Republic shall enter the United States free of duty.

section.text: Section 213A(d)(3) of the Caribbean Basin Economic Recovery Act (19 U.S.C. 2703a(d)(3)) is amended by striking terminate and inserting terminate, in whole or in part,.
